title: How England half-backs Ben Youngs and Owen Farrell repaid the faith of Eddie Jones against Australia
text:
Eddie Jones is justifiably proud of his Rugby World Cup record as a coach, which extended to 20 wins from 22 matches with England’s 40-16 victory over Australia on Saturday.

He clearly relishes the tournament’s intensity, as well as the opportunity it provides to spend greater time with his players and tailor specific tactical plans for each opposing team.

Due to Typhoon Hagibis, Jones was afforded a fortnight to prepare for a quarter-final against the Wallabies. Complicating matters, though, a pair of England’s key men – Ben Youngs and Owen Farrell – had been in indifferent form.

Typically, Jones stuck to his guns. He kept faith with two mainstays of his tenure, even shifting captain Farrell...
description: Eddie Jones is justifiably proud of his Rugby World Cup record as a coach, which extended to 20 wins from 22 matches with England’s 40-16 victory over Australia on Saturday.
